Author: DesignBlock#0184
Content:
Hello newbie here..
Can someone explain me how come "Independent blockchain on Komodo does not share infrastructure"?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: Other than notary transactions, each chain is ran and moved along by the community around it (which may or may not involve the Komodo community at large)

Author: DesignBlock#0184
Content: Quite same as EOS BPs? Can someone create its own Komodo Platform n interoperate with old Komodo?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: No, nothing like EOS. Anyone can produce a block on an assetchain; in fact, several assetchains are to where each user can create their own block for their own transaction (block-on-demand)

Author: DesignBlock#0184
Content: All assetchains are run by 60 notary nodes, right?

Author: DesignBlock#0184
Content: So there is no option to run a token/dapp just under an assetchain / Komodo platform.. having own assetchain is mandatory?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: no, assetchains are run by whomever creates them and the community they reside in (notary nodes are purely optional added security)

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can use any chain you want

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: notaries just notarized

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: much much much much less powers than BP nodes that are generating all blocks

Author: DesignBlock#0184
Content: @ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢 how? Having own miners?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for assetchains,it could be that notaries dont generate any blocks at all

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it might be a 100% PoS chain

Author: DesignBlock#0184
Content: So Komodo is POW or POS? are assetchains POS?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: https://docs.komodoplatform.com/komodo/assetchain-params.html

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: please read a bit more, there is no simple one word answer

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: @DesignBlock If you create an assetchain, how it's mined is up to you (there are many options) you can use miners, as jl suggested PoS, or even let each user create a block on demand by using thier wallet

Author: DesignBlock#0184
Content: Wow, how about Komodo itself? How it is maintained? Or Komodo is not a blockchain? But a protocol?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD is a blockchain

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
https://docs.komodoplatform.com/home-whitepaper.html
Check this out, it should help @DesignBlock

Author: DesignBlock#0184
Content: The cuccency? How about the Platform?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: what do you mean by "the Platform"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you seem to want one dimensional words when it is unclear if 3 dimensions are even enough

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe you can read something like: https://medium.com/paradigm-assotiates/komodo-detailed-review-on-the-project-ca239a018422

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: for KMD to do what it does, it cant be explained in an "elevator pitch"

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: KMD has so much power that without any code changes the community can create and launch the third highest hashrate equihash coin

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: Like ogres and onions, it has many layers

Author: DesignBlock#0184
Content: So there is no such thing as "Mainchain" in Komodo, it works for the whole yet each is independent, right?

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: Correct, each chain is a completely separate, entirely independent, full blockchain

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: there are many mainchains

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we often use the mainchain of one coin as the testnet

Author: DesignBlock#0184
Content: Who decides Komodo's development? Is there onchain governance? Like voting?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: people see something that needs to be fixed or implemented and when it works its pull request is accepted

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: a pure meritocracy

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I believe that buggy code is bad even if it is submitted in a pull request by a person of color

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or a person of any color

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: code that works, it is accepted, regardless of the submitter.

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: or a translucent person

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: or even non-persons

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: we accept pull requests from AI on occasion

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content:
`we accept pull requests from AI on occasion`
Your own PRs don't count. 😛

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I am not talking about those

Content: See, still a great project! Ahead in competition.. why not many buzz about this?

Content: We avoid paid placements

Content: Actually i just knew this, because of the design contest.. i got more interested after reading some articles..

Content: cool. I was on the fence about that, it was not what we usually do
